name: Outer Isles
economy_niches: light craft and boat-repair (pilot skiffs, shallops)
reef-charting, pilotage and oral navigation services
culture_adjustments: kinship organized around boats rather than land tenure
craft knowledge passed in kin-line households, fewer formal guild halls
calendar keyed to local tide-phenomena and storm-season markers
practical syncretism favors animistic reef rites over merchant ritual formalism
constraints: state guild licensing restricts large-scale shipbuilding
notes: vital source of local navigation lore and oral charts
supplies low-weight ritual reagents and bulk salt for state trade
